revision.text: ==Old Spanish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|osp|la|gypsum}}, from {{der|osp|grc|γύψος}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|osp|/ˈjeso/}} ===Noun=== {{osp-noun|m|-}} # [[gypsum]] #* '''c. 1250:''' [[w:Alfonso X|Alfonso X]], ''Lapidario'', f. 82v. #*: DEl .xxv. grado del ſigno de capricornio, es la piedra aque dizen del '''yeſſo'''. Piedra es blanda ¬ de color bláca ¬ ligera de quebrantar. #*:: Of the twenty-fifth degree of the sign of Capricorn is the stone they call '''gypsum'''. It is a soft stone, white in color, and easy to break apart. ====Descendants==== * {{desc|es|yeso}} [[Category:osp:Minerals]]
